intro: Draba aizoides var. beyeri, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a small perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces delicate white or pale yellow flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and have a distinctive lobed or toothed appearance. Draba aizoides var. beyeri is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers.
